definition: lit. with only four bare walls for a home (idiom)/fig. very poor/wretched

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: They were so destitute that there were only several pieces of broken furniture in the house.
sentences.chinese: 屋裏只有幾件破傢俱，真可算是家徒四壁。

sentences.english: In order to treat their children for many years, the family is utterly destitute.
sentences.chinese: 多年來爲了給孩子治病，家裏已經是家徒四壁。

sentences.english: Hehas genuine church mouse! Even the dogs learticle some sort of life than him.
sentences.chinese: 他真的家徒四壁，生活落魄得連狗都不如。

definition: extreme poverty (idiom); destitute/penniless/poor as church mice
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
without two nickels to rub together (idiom)/impoverished
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
